channel.title: Alerts Feed
channel.description: Alerts Feeds -- Los Angeles Fire Department

item.description: Traffic; INC#1525; 09:43PM; 6618 N Fallbrook Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/3TM5yPv; #WestHills; Traffic collision resulting in two injured patients. No one was trapped. Two patients are being transported in critical condition to local trauma center. LAPD Incident #4227. Nothing further.; FS 105; Batt 17; Valley Bureau; Council District 12; BC17 E105 E305 E72 EM15 EM17 RA105 RA72 RA84 RA96 T105; CH8; 17; Mark McLean

KNOCKDOWN Structure Fire; INC#0768; 12:47PM; 1700 S Penmar Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/3VNO8os; #Venice; Initial arriving firefighters found a One-story single-family home well involved. Firefighters utilized fire attack hose lines with vertical ventilation to quickly extinguished the flames and keeping the fire from spreading vertically or horizontally. It took 32 firefighters 27 minutes to extinguish the flames and achieve a knockdown. The cause and origin is currently under investigation. No reported injuries. ; FS 63; Batt 4; West Bureau; Council District 11; BC18 BC4 E263 E292 E62 E63 E67 RA5 RA63 T63 T92; CH9; 12; Mark McLean

Hiker Rescue; INC#0711; 12:14PM; 24750 W Victory Bl; MAP: https://bit.ly/3TOgtsb; West Hills; LAFD personnel assisting with mutual aid to Ventura County Fire Department with one patient non ambulatory. Nothing Further; FS 105; Batt 17; Valley Bureau; Council District 3; BC10 E105 E305 H3 H4 H5 HA3 HA4 HA5 RA106 RH114 T105; CH8; 17; Nicholas Prange

title.a: Update Technical Rescue Lower Operation 04/06/2024 INC#0385

item.description: Update Lower Operation Technical Rescue; INC#0385; 08:24AM; 5555 W Melrose Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/43RK7Bs; Hollywood; 24 Firefighters and USAR personnel on scene performed a technical rescue operation using a lowering technique with a rope system to assist one patient to the ground from a catwalk approximately 50' above ground level. Patient on the ground level and is being medically evaluated by LAFD paramedics. Nothing Further. ; FS 52; Batt 5; West Bureau; Council District 13; BC11 BC5 E227 E229 E27 E52 EM11 HR3 RA52 RA827 RA88 T27 T29 UR27 UR88; CH7; 12; Mark McLean

Technical Rescue; INC#0385; 08:24AM; 5555 W Melrose Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/43RK7Bs; Hollywood; Firefighters are assisting unknown patient stuck on a catwalk who is unable get down. USAR personnel are on scene establishing operation plan for possible technical rescue to assist one patient to the ground. ; FS 52; Batt 5; West Bureau; Council District 13; BC11 BC5 E227 E229 E27 E52 EM11 HR3 RA52 RA827 RA88 T27 T29 UR88; CH7; 12; Mark McLean

Train vs Pedestrian - Fatality; INC#1506; 09:13PM; 662 S Alvarado St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3weLF6z; #Westlake; Firefighters responded to the Metro B (Red) Line station to find one person had been fatally struck by a train. Firefighters will assist LAPD and Medical Examiner with the body recovery. Unknown age/gender/circumstances. Nothing further.; FS 11; Batt 11; Central Bureau; Council District 1; BC11 BC13 E11 E13 E20 E209 E211 E220 E9 EM1 HR3 RA11 SQ21 T11 T20 T9; CH7; 15; Nicholas Prange

KNOCKDOWN Structure Fire; INC#0193; 09:21AM; 1416 S Main St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3xgPvBF; #DowntownLA; Firefighters continued operating in defensive mode for several hours, knocking back flare ups from adjacent rooftops, and protecting the neighboring buildings. The commercial building contained large amounts of clothing/textiles while burned readily and continued to fuel the fire. The roof partially collapsed part way through the incident, and firefighters maintained their strategies, waiting for the rest to collapse and give hose streams a straight shot at the burning materials beneath. Remote Suppression firefighting vehicle "RS3" was used to enter the unstable structure and gain access to better suppression angles and deeper penetration. Overall, it took 120 firefighters 4 hours and 12 minutes to extinguish the flames, however much of the debris within the rubble contains extremely hot spots that will need to be uncovered by LAFD Heavy Equipment. Thankfully, there were no reported injuries. Fire Investigators are on scene conducting a fire-cause investigation.; FS 10; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 14; AR1 AR11 AR14 AR22 BC1 BC11 BC13 BC5 CM20 CM22 E10 E11 E13 E14 E15 E2 E203 E209 E210 E211 E215 E220 E221 E226 E294 E3 E63 E66 E9 E95 EA1 EM11 EX2 HE4 HE5 HR3 PI4 RA10 RA3 RA803 RA810 RS3 SO1 SQ21 SQ95 T10 T11 T15 T20 T21 T26 T3 T9 T94 UR3 UR88; CH7; 12 13 15; Nicholas Prange

title.a: Update Major Emergency Structure Fire 04/05/2024 INC#0193

item.description: Update Major Emergency Structure Fire; INC#0193; 06:46AM; 1416 S Main St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3xgPvBF; #DowntownLA; Firefighters continue to fight this commercial fire in defensive mode. A heavy fire load (reported as clothing/textiles) and a mezzanine inside have contributed to the fire behavior. The building has sustained a partial roof collapse. Firefighters have established positions on adjacent buildings on either side using hand lines to keep the flames at bay, but due to the condition of the building, this will be an extended operation. Crews are prioritizing the neighboring buildings, and will need to bring in LAFD Heavy Equipment crews to finalize extinguishment later this morning. So far, there have been no reported injuries. MOTORISTS: Avoid Main Street, near 14th St & 15th St (street closed due to fire apparatus).; FS 10; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 14; AR1 AR14 AR22 BC1 BC11 BC13 BC5 CM20 CM22 E10 E11 E13 E14 E15 E2 E203 E209 E210 E211 E215 E221 E226 E3 E9 E95 EA1 EM11 HE4 HE5 HR3 PI4 RA10 RA3 RA803 RA810 SO1 SQ21 SQ95 T10 T11 T15 T21 T26 T3 T9 UR3 UR88; CH9; 12 13 15; Nicholas Prange
